text: * Node.js uses asynchronous I/0O programming! « It runs single-threaded, non-blocking, asynchronous programming, which is very memory efficient - no thread context switching. » Node.js can generate dynamic page content « it can create, open, read, write, delete, and close files on the server; « it can collect form data; « it can create, read, update, delete data in your database » Node.js is great for event-driven (callback) architectures, facilitating scalability and real-time web applications (like real-time communications, browser games...).
